Def.Name: Balsam Poplar
Def.Description: Medium/large tree growing 40' - 90' tall and 2' wide. Tall open crown.
Def.Leaves: Simple, alternate, 3" - 6" long, 1 1/2" - 3" wide. Fine blunt toothed margins. Glossy green turning yellow in autumn. May have round leafstalk.
Def.Twigs: Red/brown with orange lenticels (dots). Star shaped pith. Buds are red/brown about 1" long, sticky and pointed. Smells like balsam.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Capsule with many seeds that may have cotton like hairs. 4" - 6" catkins that mature in spring.
Def.Bark: Green/brown, smooth and becoming gray/black with deep furrows that have flat ridges.
Def.Remarks: Fast growing and normally short lived. Some have said one exists over 200 years old and its located above the artic circle.
